Adjust global configurations for the client.
Allows you to change various animations.
Allows you to change the color of the client.
Displays the IP of the server you are playing on.
Displays the direction you're facing in degrees.
Shows your speed in blocks per second.
Shows the reach of your last hit. Not 10 accurate due to latency!
Shows the number of hits you land on an enemy without getting hit.
Displays the name and description of your texture packs on screen.
Shows the armor and mainhand item you have equipped.
Enables movement and scaling of the paperdoll.
Displays your current status effects and their duration.
Proximity Chat! Allows you to use Mumble Link via the Onix Client Mumble Link application.
Changes perspective while the key is pressed.

Various tools to help with creative mode.
Note: Only use this with permission if you are on someone else's world/server.
Allows you to fine-tune your click settings.
Allows you to zoom in on distant objects.
Makes the surrounding environment brighter. Allows you to see more clearly in The End, Nether, and at night. Will not work with RTX or Vibrant Visuals.
A basic recreation of the Java Edition debug menu.
Draws a border around the chunk you are in.

Changes the selected block outline/overlay.
- The \"Outline Selection\" setting needs to be enabled in video settings.
Draws a bounding box around all entities.

Displays and stores coordinates of specific locations in the world.
- To create a waypoint, type ".waypoint" in the Minecraft chat.
Shows a list of all players in the world.
Changes what color entities will be when hurt.
Displays the detonation time of TNT.
Displays the nearby areas where mobs are able to spawn.
Makes dropped items have unique physics.
Change the size of your GUI.
Allows you to modify various aspects of the fog!
Pans the camera around when moving your mouse while in a UI.
A Flappy Bird clone playable in Minecraft!
A Minecraft version of the classic game Snake!
Enables sprinting or sneaking without holding the respective keys.
Various tweaks to the entities. If you have any suggestions for this module, please let us know.
The Java gamemode switcher ported to Bedrock.
Allows you to hide your own and other people's usernames.
Fixes an issue which causes some items to be huge when held.
Makes the camera smooth, similar to the cinematic camera in OptiFine.
Blurs movement to make you throw up suspiciously
Makes the surrounding area illuminate when equipped with light-emitting items.
Displays a red vignette on the screen when you have low health.
Multiply the amount of hit particles.

Automatically says GG (or any message) at the end of the game.
Works on Hive, CubeCraft, Zeqa, NetherGames, Hyperlands.
Customise your crosshair to your heart's content.
Automatically sends a message when a key is pressed.
Makes the second skin layer 3D. Due to how the mod works, this will not work with players who have 128x skins or custom geometries (4D Skins).

Makes the items appear as if they were 2D like the old bedrock.
Note: The items are still 3D, so you don't save performance.
Makes items blink when they are about to despawn.

Reminds you to adhere 20 20 20. (For every 20 minutes that pass, look 20 meters away for 20 seconds at a time).
- This helps preserve your eyesight! (And I can't remember to do it, so I made this (I still don't use it...)).
Allows you to customize the field of view behavior.
Allows you to place the camera over your shoulder.
Allows you to customise the view model. (Hand Item).
Makes your main hand be the left hand. People (Seraphim) wanted this for some reason. So sure. Why not. Have fun I guess.
Allows you to change your perspective based on your current situation.
Allows you to rotate your camera/screen to any roll.
Scale individual items to be a custom size.

Allows you to lower or raise the first person fire over.
Note: This is calibrated by default for the vanilla fire overlay!
- If you have a low fire pack already, you may not see the fire overlay with the default values.
Disables the screen shake when view bobbing is enabled. (Requires view bobbing to be enabled.)
Allows you to change the skybox without leaving the world.
Prevents you from breaking ungrown crops. Sneak to bypass.
Lets you view and manage command blocks in a chain from one command block.
Allows you to look at your surroundings without changing movement direction.
Modifies keybind handling when exiting screens to act like Java 1.12+.

When two opposing movement directions are pressed, it will only register the last pressed input as the priority.
Look at Razer's Snap Tap mode for a better understanding.
Makes the controller trigger button inputs be customisably sensitive.
Makes some items easier to observe.
Displays when and how many items you pick up or drop.
Allows you to enhance the visual look of your game.
A port of the Java inventory hotkeys to Bedrock.
Let's you modify the camera shake animation when you get destroyed in PvP. (If there is no setting, update your DLL).
Shows the number of instant health potions you currently possess.
Shows the number of soups in your inventory.
Displays how many arrows you have in your inventory.
Displays the total count of the hand item in your inventory.
Shows the surrounding audio that's played in the world.
Displays the amount of in-game day or playtime.
Allows customization and movement of the scoreboard.
Displays your ping to the server.
Displays information about blocks when you look at them.
Displays the RAM usage of the game.
Displays a stopwatch on the screen.
Allows you to customize basically every aspect of the title.
Allows you to view the contents of a shulker box without opening it.
Improves the vanilla item tooltips with extra information about the item, the ability to copy the text, and the ability to scroll in the tooltip.
A collection of tools useful to developers.
